alert.note: Alert for Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 10 at 12:43AM CDT until May 10 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Scotts Bluff County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... * Until 1230 AM MDT. * At 1142 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Gering, or near Scottsbluff, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Public. This storm has a history of producing quarter to half dollar sized hail. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * Locations impacted include... Scottsbluff, Gering, Terrytown, Lake Minatare Campground, Scottsbluff Airport, Lake Minatare, Scotts Bluff National Monument and Lake Alice. This replaces the Severe Thunderstorm Warning which was previously in effect for the warned area. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
